Welcome to the City of Palatka
Throughout the 1800s and 1900s, Palatka has best been known as a hub for commerce due in large to the St. John’s River. It’s been used to deliver cattle, freight, lumber, and citrus, making it a spot ripe with history and tourism.
While the population of Palatka has swelled and dwindled in size throughout the years, the one thing that hasn’t changed is that it’s the gateway to the St. John’s River.
Nowadays, the Palatka Riverfront plays a huge part in events and festivals. The Riverfront hosts more than 20+ fishing tournaments a year including Bass Pro tournaments.
Keep your eye on this space for everything that’s coming up!

About the Riverfront
About the Riverfront
As the gateway to the St. John’s River, Palatka Riverfront has everything you need to have a great time. Whether you’re traveling through or looking for a place to have a good time, the riverfront has a little bit of something that everyone can enjoy.
The Palatka Riverfront is
a unique getaway from other riverside experiences. Enjoy the river that our town loves so much through kayaking, cruising, celebrating and playing while appreciating the small-town feel that Palatka offers.
With its big town amenities, but small town charm, we hope you stay a while and enjoy everything that we offer!
